content.text: To establish and maintain strategic relationships with external organizations, universities, and industry partners that enhance student learning opportunities, support university placement, and provide clear career pathways.
A comprehensive university counseling program supports students in identifying and applying to higher education institutions that best fit their aspirations and potential.

content.title: Key Services
items: University fairs and visits from admissions representatives.
Support with application procedures (UCAS, Common App, etc.) and scholarship applications.
Preparation for entrance exams (SAT, IELTS, TOEFL).

content.text: Partnerships with businesses and organizations provide students with real-world exposure and practical experience.

items: Internship Programs: Structured work experience opportunities for Grade 11/12 students.
Guest Speaker Series: Industry professionals sharing insights and career advice.
Industry Visits: Field trips to companies and organizations to observe professional environments.

content.text: Maintaining a strong connection with alumni fosters a supportive community and provides mentorship opportunities for current students.

items: Alumni Database: Maintaining up-to-date contact information.
Alumni Events: Reunions and networking gatherings.
Mentorship Program: Connecting alumni with current students for guidance.

content.text: Formal partnerships are governed by MoUs to ensure clarity of expectations and mutual benefit.

items: Review Process: All MoUs must be reviewed by the School Leadership Team and Legal Counsel.
Renewal: Regular assessment of partnership effectiveness prior to renewal.
Compliance: Ensuring partners adhere to school safeguarding and ethical standards.
